data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: J-MELO
data.description:
*This program was first broadcast on April 13, 2025. 
Join May J. for Japanese music! This week: Furui Riho (a singer-songwriter with gospel roots) and shallm (a band project from vocalist, lyricist, and composer lia).
On Demand until October 26, 2025

data.title: Little Charo
data.description: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home.

data.title: Japanology Plus mini
data.description: The waxing and waning moon. Throughout Japan's history, it has been loved, cherished and given many special names. Moon-viewing events are held across the country at the time of the beautiful harvest moon, which occurs during the eighth month of the traditional calendar. And the moon's gravitational pull has long been important in agriculture and fishing. We introduce Japan's aesthetic appreciation of the moon and look at some new technology being developed for use on the lunar surface itself.

data.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
data.description: We meet a cat who fearlessly patrols crocodile enclosures heated by onsen steam. At a shopping arcade, we encounter early rising cats and a tengu statue. We even meet cats who enjoy billiards!
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;A Cat's-Eye View of Japan_Beppu: A Steam-Filled Onsen Resort;w01,001;6045-051-2025;2025-10-20T00:55:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;A Cat's-Eye View of Japan_Beppu: A Steam-Filled Onsen Resort;en,001;6045-051-2025;2025-10-20T00:55:00+09:00

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Somewhere Street
data.description: Gyeongju, located 280 kilometers southeast of Seoul in South Korea, was the capital of the ancient Silla kingdom from 57 BCE to 935 CE. The city is dotted with over 200 ancient burial mounds from that era. It is truly a city rich in history. Known as the "Museum Without Walls," the city is renowned for its relics, temples, palaces and tombs from the Silla Era that offer a glimpse into Korea's ancient past. In 2000, the old town and surrounding areas were registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

data.title: Time-lapse Journey
data.description: Nikko, in Tochigi Prefecture, is home to much natural beauty with its great mountains and lakes. Located at a convenient distance from Tokyo, many come to escape from the summer heat. The ornate Nikko Toshogu Shrine is a popular spiritual place. See the widely beloved Nikko through time-lapse photography.

data.title: National Parks of Japan
data.description: Daisen-Oki National Park comprises islands and a mainland area with a coast and mountain range. Home to shrines and sacred mountains, it's been the setting of Japanese myths. Join us on a cruise with spectacular sights and a trek across the mainland, where we observe a daily morning ritual at Miho Shrine and climb the majestic Mt. Daisen.

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: RAMEN JAPAN
data.description: This time in Wakayama Prefecture, heartland of shoyu, we find a distinctive ramen culture pairing ramen and ... sushi?!

data.title: Core Kyoto
data.episodeTitle: Core Kyoto mini Setsubun: Out with the Demons and in with Fortune
data.description: February 3 is the Lunar New Year's Eve and is the boundary between winter and spring. Soybeans are scattered for good fortune in the coming year, expelling the demons that represent misfortune and calamity. Yoshida Jinja shrine protects Kyoto at the "demon's gate" in the northeast with a ritual in which the "shaman" wears a four-eyed mask. Discover how Kyotoites pray for a peaceful life.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Core Kyoto_Core Kyoto mini Setsubun: Out with the Demons and in with Fortune;w01,001;6024-035-2025;2025-10-20T02:25:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Core Kyoto_Core Kyoto mini Setsubun: Out with the Demons and in with Fortune;en,001;6024-035-2025;2025-10-20T02:25:00+09:00

data.title: Easy Japanese for Work
data.episodeTitle: #38 Taking over someone's work without hurting their feelings
data.description: Today: taking over someone's work without hurting their feelings. Aung Zin Phyo, from Myanmar, works for a firm that makes architectural 3DCG images. These images are used in various types of presentations. He joined this company last year. He supervises his colleagues who work in Vietnam. Since both parties are communicating in Japanese rather than their native languages, he aims to take care with how he expresses himself. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge, in which he must help out a coworker who is struggling with their workload.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Easy Japanese for Work_#38 Taking over someone's work without hurting their feelings;w01,001;2078-038-2025;2025-10-20T02:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Easy Japanese for Work_#38 Taking over someone's work without hurting their feelings;en,001;2078-038-2025;2025-10-20T02:30:00+09:00

data.title: Zero Waste Life
data.description: Produce is generally uniform in color, shape and size due to strict standards, which also makes for improved efficiency, but it means deviations aren't tolerated. Suyama Chimi, who studied agriculture at university, set out to open an eatery using the waste generated, so-called "substandard" produce donated by local farmers. Since costs are low, the meals are low-cost too. In the kitchen every day since graduation, her place is always busy and has become a hub for the nearby community.

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: One Man's Quest: Reviving Japan's Semiconductor Industry
data.description: A Japanese entrepreneur is on a mission: reviving Japan's semiconductor industry. With over ten billion dollars of tax money at stake, he races for rapid innovation.

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Core Kyoto
data.episodeTitle: Core Kyoto Special: The Cultural Heart of Zen
data.description: The Zen school of Buddhism emphasizes the practice of zazen meditation as the path to enlightenment. The spirit of Zen flows through the gardens, art, cuisine and other aspects of Kyoto culture.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Core Kyoto_Core Kyoto Special: The Cultural Heart of Zen;w01,001;3025-253-2025;2025-10-20T04:10:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Core Kyoto_Core Kyoto Special: The Cultural Heart of Zen;en,001;3025-253-2025;2025-10-20T04:10:00+09:00

data.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
data.description: This time, two naginata (polearms) associated with legendary warriors: Benkei and Tomoe Gozen.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces_Naginata-wielding Heroes;w01,001;6059-010-2025;2025-10-20T04:54:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces_Naginata-wielding Heroes;en,001;6059-010-2025;2025-10-20T04:54:00+09:00

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: ANIME MANGA EXPLOSION
data.episodeTitle: Classic Tales Reborn: SAINT SEIYA / TOUGEN ANKI
data.description:
This episode explores manga and anime that breathe new life into classic myths and folktales.
We take a closer look at SAINT SEIYA, inspired by Greek mythology, and TOUGEN ANKI, a fresh spin on Japan's famous legend about Momotaro.
Watch and discover how familiar stories are reborn through the creative process.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;ANIME MANGA EXPLOSION_Classic Tales Reborn: SAINT SEIYA / TOUGEN ANKI;w01,001;2099-024-2025;2025-10-20T05:10:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;ANIME MANGA EXPLOSION_Classic Tales Reborn: SAINT SEIYA / TOUGEN ANKI;en,001;2099-024-2025;2025-10-20T05:10:00+09:00

data.title: The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends
data.description:
Hoppie and her mates make Juras the odd man out, and they wander into picture-book land leaving him behind. When they are captured by the Mushroom Witch, unexpected help comes to them.

Educational theme: Keeping good relationships and helping one another.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends_Beware of the Gingerbread House;w01,001;4034-009-2025;2025-10-20T05:40:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends_Beware of the Gingerbread House;en,001;4034-009-2025;2025-10-20T05:40:00+09:00

data.title: Listen to the Earth
data.episodeTitle: How to Stay Safe When a Typhoon Hits
data.description: Typhoons can cause flooding, landslides, storm tides and other devastating phenomena. Figure out the places in your area that would be dangerous, and then make a "hazard map."
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Listen to the Earth_How to Stay Safe When a Typhoon Hits;w01,001;4041-009-2025;2025-10-20T05:50:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Listen to the Earth_How to Stay Safe When a Typhoon Hits;en,001;4041-009-2025;2025-10-20T05:50:00+09:00

data.title: Chatroom Japan
data.episodeTitle: I Was Born in Japan and Called Gaijin
data.description: Imagine being called an outsider in the country where you were born. Chuk Besher knows what that's like. It made him ask questions about identity and diversity.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Chatroom Japan_I Was Born in Japan and Called Gaijin;w01,001;6049-029-2025;2025-10-20T09:10:00+09:00

data.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
data.episodeTitle: EXPO 2025 ep.5 Nature-Based Solutions to Sea Level Rise
data.description: The low-elevation South Pacific islands are seriously threatened by sea level rise due to global warming. Attempts are underway to raise them with Nature-based solutions, using star sand and coral.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;IMPACTS: Climates Change the World_EXPO 2025 ep.5 Nature-Based Solutions to Sea Level Rise;w01,001;6128-009-2025;2025-10-20T09:15:00+09:00

data.title: DESIGN MUSEUM JAPAN
data.description:
Yamagata Prefecture / Minagawa Akira (Designer)
To make a "dantsu" carpet, everything from yarn-making to weaving is done by hand. Minagawa experiences the deep allure of handmade goods.

data.title: Where We Call Home
data.episodeTitle: Broadening the Boundaries of Arita Ware
data.description: In Saga Prefecture, we meet South Korean Lee Hyojin who runs an Arita porcelain gallery in the town by the same name, and Slovenia-born Vera Tokunaga who works at a Japanese tea shop in Ureshino City.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Where We Call Home_Broadening the Boundaries of Arita Ware;w01,001;2087-159-2025;2025-10-20T09:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Where We Call Home_Broadening the Boundaries of Arita Ware;en,001;2087-159-2025;2025-10-20T09:30:00+09:00

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Time-lapse Japan
data.description: The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea. We explore their history and legacy, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time, Seto Inland Sea.

data.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
data.description: What does it take to survive a flood? Japan has developed survival skills for floods through experiences such as typhoons. Find out how to safely navigate flooded streets and escape sinking cars.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life_#42 How to Survive a Flood;w01,001;2090-038-2025;2025-10-20T10:15:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life_#42 How to Survive a Flood;en,001;2090-038-2025;2025-10-20T10:15:00+09:00

data.title: Magical Japanese
data.description: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to ne, or "root." Japan's agricultural history has inspired many unique expressions associated with roots. Today, many of them have also taken root in the business world. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through these words and the culture behind them.

data.title: Easy Japanese
data.description: Introducing yourself is easy. Put "desu" after your name or occupation to explain who you are and what you do.

data.title: Culture Crossroads
data.episodeTitle: BOSAI: Be Prepared - Earthquake! Tips for Staying Safe
data.description: What should you do when an earthquake occurs? Learn how TV and cell phone alerts work and the correct actions to take in different situations, such as when cooking at home or riding on a train.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Culture Crossroads_BOSAI: Be Prepared - Earthquake! Tips for Staying Safe;w01,001;2084-030-2025;2025-10-20T10:45:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Culture Crossroads_BOSAI: Be Prepared - Earthquake! Tips for Staying Safe;en,001;2084-030-2025;2025-10-20T10:45:00+09:00

data.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
data.description: NHK's services are playing a larger role in governmental support for foreign residents. We see how a support center in Tokyo is promoting NHK WORLD-JAPAN as part of its multilingual support.

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Seasoning the Seasons
data.episodeTitle: Songs of Okinawa: The Bonds of Community
data.description: Songs are part of the fabric of life in Okinawa Prefecture. When a song rings out, everyone naturally starts to dance. Okinawa is a prefecture in the south of Japan composed of a main island and more than 100 smaller islands. In times of happiness and sadness too, the rhythms of Okinawa fill the air. Singing songs always reminds Okinawan people of home. We lend our ears to the sound of Okinawa to hear these islands' stories.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Seasoning the Seasons_Songs of Okinawa: The Bonds of Community;w01,001;2024-124-2025;2025-10-20T11:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Seasoning the Seasons_Songs of Okinawa: The Bonds of Community;en,001;2024-124-2025;2025-10-20T11:30:00+09:00

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: BIZ STREAM
data.description:
[On-Site Report: Inspecting the World Within]
This episode features remotely operated vehicles with unique designs that were engineered to inspect difficult to access spaces.

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Hometown Stories
data.episodeTitle: Tuning a Piano to the Sound of the Heart
data.description: Shiomi Hirokazu is one of the few experts in Japan entrusted with tuning pianos for concert halls. Whether tuning for a top pianist or a small child, his aim is to capture the sound in their heart.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Hometown Stories_Tuning a Piano to the Sound of the Heart;w01,001;5003-299-2025;2025-10-20T13:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Hometown Stories_Tuning a Piano to the Sound of the Heart;en,001;5003-299-2025;2025-10-20T13:30:00+09:00

data.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
data.description: Hi, it's me, Tama! Today my humans, Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko, left wearing strange outfits. That's because they're going to pick himetake bamboo shoots with two experts. I hope they get enough for me, too!

data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Hometown Stories_Tuning a Piano to the Sound of the Heart;en,001;5003-299-2025;2025-10-20T17:30:00+09:00

data.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
data.description: Hi, it's me, Tama! Today my humans, Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko, left wearing strange outfits. That's because they're going to pick himetake bamboo shoots with two experts. I hope they get enough for me, too!

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: BIZ STREAM
data.description:
[On-Site Report: Inspecting the World Within]
This episode features remotely operated vehicles with unique designs that were engineered to inspect difficult to access spaces.

data.title: NHK NEWS 7
data.description: News 7 is NHK's flagship domestic evening news program, bringing you the latest from our Tokyo studio. It's presented with English audio on NHK World for our international viewers

data.title: Where We Call Home
data.episodeTitle: Broadening the Boundaries of Arita Ware
data.description: In Saga Prefecture, we meet South Korean Lee Hyojin who runs an Arita porcelain gallery in the town by the same name, and Slovenia-born Vera Tokunaga who works at a Japanese tea shop in Ureshino City.

data.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
data.description: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

data.title: Direct Talk
data.episodeTitle: Creating Never-Before-Seen Landscapes: Ishigami Junya / Architect
data.description: In 2024, Ishigami Junya received the prestigious Austrian Frederick Kiesler Prize for Architecture and the Arts. He talks about his groundbreaking work and ponders the meaning of architecture.

data.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
data.description: Our focus this time is wasabi, the fiery root that is a pillar of Japanese foods like sushi and sashimi. Visit a traditional wasabi field in Shizuoka Prefecture recognized as one of the world's Globally Important Agricultural Heritage Systems, try futuristic wasabi dishes, and find out why you most likely need a new wasabi grater! (Reporter: Kyle Card)

data.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
data.episodeTitle: Clam-Digging at the Beach in Style
data.description: It's spring, and a group of young men and women have come to the beach for some recreational clam-digging. The sea breeze mixes with the smell of freshly-cooked seafood. There's also love in the air.

data.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
data.description: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

data.title: Magical Japanese
data.description: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to ne, or "root." Japan's agricultural history has inspired many unique expressions associated with roots. Today, many of them have also taken root in the business world. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through these words and the culture behind them.

data.title: Easy Japanese
data.description: Introducing yourself is easy. Put "desu" after your name or occupation to explain who you are and what you do.

data.title: Culture Crossroads
data.episodeTitle: BOSAI: Be Prepared - Earthquake! Tips for Staying Safe
data.description: What should you do when an earthquake occurs? Learn how TV and cell phone alerts work and the correct actions to take in different situations, such as when cooking at home or riding on a train.

data.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
data.description: NHK's services are playing a larger role in governmental support for foreign residents. We see how a support center in Tokyo is promoting NHK WORLD-JAPAN as part of its multilingual support.

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE

data.title: Seasoning the Seasons
data.episodeTitle: Songs of Okinawa: The Bonds of Community
data.description: Songs are part of the fabric of life in Okinawa Prefecture. When a song rings out, everyone naturally starts to dance. Okinawa is a prefecture in the south of Japan composed of a main island and more than 100 smaller islands. In times of happiness and sadness too, the rhythms of Okinawa fill the air. Singing songs always reminds Okinawan people of home. We lend our ears to the sound of Okinawa to hear these islands' stories.

data.title: Medical Frontiers
data.episodeTitle: Muse Cells: A New Stem Cell Treatment
data.description: Muse cells, discovered by a Japanese researcher, are found in the human body and have the unique ability to repair tissues. We examine their potential in treating intractable diseases.
